profiles.name: Abdelaziz Abdelrasol
profiles.summary:
GenAI Engineer bei Vector Informatik GmbH | LLMs | Python | FastAPI | AI Infrastructure | Embedded Software · AI Engineer | Software Developer | Embedded Systems Expert
I am a passionate Software Engineer with a diverse background in AI, GenAI (LLMs), and Embedded Software Development. Currently, I work as a GenAI Engineer at Vector Informatik, focusing on the development and deployment of Generative AI systems using FastAPI, Python, LlamaIndex, and LLM fine-tuning.

Previously, I spent years in automotive software engineering, delivering Flash Bootloaders, OFR solutions, and embedded systems for Mercedes-Benz, Volkswagen, Renault, and other OEMs. My technical expertise spans Python, C, AUTOSAR, AI Agents deployment, cloud infrastructure, and software architecture.

✅ Key Expertise:

Generative AI (GenAI) & LLMs – Fine-tuning, Prompt Engineering, AI Agents

Software Development – Python, FastAPI, AI Infrastructure, Cloud Deployment

Embedded Systems – Flash Bootloader, AUTOSAR, UDS, C Programming

profiles.name: Paul Gaikwad
profiles.summary:
Embedded Software Engineer | C++ | Python | Real-Time Systems | Distributed Middleware | MSc INFOTECH – University of Stuttgart · I am a Master’s student in INFOTECH at the University of Stuttgart, having recently completed my thesis at Mercedes-Benz AG, where I focused on evaluating messaging middleware for distributed ECU testing in the automotive domain. My work proposed a broker-based framework, simulating real-world long-distance testing conditions and optimising message handling to improve performance and reliability across geographically distributed setups.

Before that, at IAV GmbH, I worked on ECU software validation using Vector CANoe and INCA, achieving higher testing efficiency through Python-based automation. My foundation in embedded systems and communication protocols was further strengthened through my role at Vertiv, where I developed embedded software solutions and contributed to quality assurance and automation.

What excites me most is turning messy, complex data into clear insights and practical solutions. I enjoy bridging the gap between raw numbers and meaningful outcomes, whether that’s improving prediction accuracy, building dashboards for resource management, or exploring new ways to apply AI in real-world systems.

profiles.name: Thiago Genez
profiles.summary:
Senior Software Engineer @ Qt Group | PhD in Computer Science · 👋 About Me: 
I’m a Senior Software Engineer at The Qt Group in Stuttgart, Germany, with a strong focus on DevOps, automation, and CI/CD pipelines, working mainly with Jenkins and GitLab.

Previously, I worked at EMBL-EBI (European Bioinformatics Institute) in Cambridge, UK, where I contributed to high-performance computing (HPC) pipelines running on SLURM, and supported bioinformatics platforms using Terraform and Kubernetes.

I hold a Doctorate (Dr.) in Computer Science from the University of Campinas (Unicamp), Brazil, and bring over five years of R&D experience in cloud computing. My expertise spans data analytics, problem modeling, and optimisation.

🚀 What I enjoy most:
Solving complex technical problems, building robust infrastructure, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable, cloud-based solutions.
